frameDefinitions: The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.

This frame concerns Acts and State_of_Affairs for which Protagonists are responsible and which either follow or violate some set of rules  or Norms. '' 'A lot of people suspect that blocking savers' access to their money violates the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government.'
A Fugitive avoids recapture by or on the authority of Authorities in relation to a Crime which the Fugitive has committed or is suspected of having committed.
A Person is a member of an organized military organization belonging to a nation-state or similar body.
A Theme is held in captivity by an Agent or Cause.
This frame contains words for individuals, i.e. humans, who are governed by virtue of being registered in a certain Jurisdiction.
frameExamples: The first <t>calamity</t> was a disastrous trade war with Holland.
A lot of people suspect that blocking savers' access to their money <t>violates</t> the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government.
He is in fact a <t>fugitive</t> of the law and you must inform the police if you see him.
The British at one point had an occupying army of over a million well-trained <t><fex name='Person'>soldiers</fex></t>.
Twenty soldiers were in <t>captivity</t> for over a month before they were released
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s behavior is in or out of compliance with norms.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that is judged to be in or out of compliance with the <fen>Norm</fen>s.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> may violate a law or rule.
This role identifies the rules or <fen>Norm</fen>s that ought to guide a person's behavior.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen>  when the act of compliance or non-compliance occurs.
The <fen>Fugitive</fen> has escaped and/or is evading capture by law enforcement <fen>Authorities</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is evading law enforcement.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fugitive</fen> is located.
The <fen>Person</fen> is the member of the military.
The area within which the <fen>Theme</fen> is confined.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Theme</fen> is held captive.
This role identifies the general <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Theme</fen> is held captive.
listRoleExamples: An <fex>environmental</fex> disaster is just what we need.
Jo's <fex><t>violation</t></fex> of the no trespassing law came as a surprise.
John violated <fex>the law</fex> by not paying taxes.
Only two years earlier <fex>she</fex> had been on the lam from charges of embezzlement.
He was a fugitive <fex>in the early 1990s</fex>.
Sloan, on the lam <fex>in Michigan</fex> for the last five months, is due to appear in court this Monday.
<fex>He</fex> was in captivity for six days.
The captives <fex>in the next room</fex> were fed well but otherwise ignored.
